author: Odeinoichus
title: DC's Ultimate Villain Pair Smash Through Dimensions.
review:
Set #71229 DC Comics Team Pack: Here we come to the final Team Pack in Series 1, at least from my reviewing docket, and it’s one of the more collectible packs with characters that are fan favorites and add some great dialogue and comedy moments to the game while playing. Is it a must have? I suppose that depends entirely on how you view getting a set with very little in the way of new digital content. As a collectible display item however it’s really quite solid.

Packaging

Joker and Harley are posed quite menacingly in the artwork on the front of this packaging and Wayne Enterprises is seen right next to the Daily Planet in the skyline in the back. Otherwise it’s the same design we’ve seen in all LEGO Dimensions packs.

Parts

Nothing really rare in this set, a lot of commonly found elements from LEGO sets, the colouring however may attract parts enthusiasts as Joker Green and Purple are somewhat prevalent and Harley’s red and black colouring is used on a lot of elements.

Minifigures

Harley Quinn: Found in two sets, this version of Harley is not unique and aside from her accessory everything about her has been seen before. Her accessory is a buildable hammer which I believe can be considered unique to the set.

The Joker: Unlike Harley this version of Joker is unique to this set, at least as far as the use of the parts. While the parts were seen separately before, this particular combination of parts is unique to the Dimensions Team Pack. As is often he is using the Joke Gun with a tommy gun piece with a LEGO flag attached to the barrel.

The build

The Joker’s Chopper & Alternate Builds: Each one of these builds uses the same number of parts to build three separate vehicles and the best build in my opinion is the first, it was commendable that the designers tried their best to make three unique vehicles, but I did not find the second or third models at all satisfying to build.

Quinn-mobile & Alternate Builds: In the complete opposite I found all three of these builds fairly interesting and very well thought out, each model is built with the same amount of pieces and each of the models looks great as individual vehicles for Harley to drive.

The completed model

The Joker’s Chopper: This is the best model from The Joker’s vehicle repertoire in the entire set. It doesn’t quite match the slightly larger looking model Joker uses inside the game, but it catches the look the closest it can and is a lot of fun to play with off the toy pad as well.

Mischievous Missile Blaster: This is a terrible model, it’s supposed to be a plane, but it just fails to look like anything other than a helicopter torn apart and rebuilt rather poorly into an imitation one prop flyer. The limited number of parts here is a huge disappointment and a knock against the potential rebuilds for this model.

The Joker’s Lock ‘n Laser Jet: This model is bland, it is a reverse of the secondary model with the parts rearranged to make a rear mounted prop plane, and it just looks goofy. Like it wouldn’t be able to fly even if it had two engines.

Quinn-mobile: A very solid four-wheeled vehicle model that rolls and has a small hammer attached to it for smashing LEGO objects. One of the stronger models buildable in the set.

Quinn Ultra Racer: This one is also very well designed, it’s a low-to-the-ground race car that can zip forward quickly to smash through things. Really impressed with it.

Missile Launcher: The third and final model Harley uses is a chunky looking four-wheeled vehicle with a huge missile launcher on the back and the model is overall quite fun to play with off the toy pad also. All of these models roll well, are very well designed compared to Joker’s and do not compromise the look of the in-game model.

The Digital Content

The Adventure World: As I’ve noted in other packs this is yet another release that grants you access to DC Comics World, which is open from the Starter Pack and so most of these packs are only worth getting for abilities or your favorite heroes and villains to interact with one another. Considering who is in this pack I suspect it will be a favorite of many, since The Joker and Harley Quinn are very desirable by many.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: The Joker can Grapple, has Hazard Protection, can Target and use Electricity switches. Harley has the Acrobat skill and can destroy Cracked LEGO Objects.

Joker’s Vehicles are all Flying contraptions and as such each of them can access Flight Cargo Hooks and Flight Docks, the Chopper and Mischievous Missile Blaster both have Special Attack abilities while the third model also adds the power to Destroy Gold LEGO Objects.

Harley’s vehicles are all ground based. Her Quinn-Mobile can use Accelerator Switches, the Racer has the Tow Bar and Speed Boost abilities and the Missile Launcher gives us the ability to Destroy Silver LEGO Objects.

Overall opinion

Overall the DC Comics Team Pack is a solid offering for the most part, Joker’s vehicles suffer considerably due to the very limited number of pieces and the primary model is the best of the bunch as a toy. Interestingly none of the Team Packs tried to make combination models with all the parts, which might have helped in this case.

If you’re a fan of Harley Quinn you’ll probably want to bring her into LEGO Dimensions, so I’d recommend this set as one to get for that reason alone, even if the Digital content and abilities aren’t unique or needed for full 100% completion of the game. Recommended.
